TopicDetails.title: Periodical publications

latestInfos.content: Due to the exceptional ongoing circumstances, the deadline of this Call for Proposals HERCULE-LT-2020 is extended from 7 May to 27 May 2020.

3295362.action: HERCULE-LT-2020-02 - HERCULE-AG Hercule III Action Grant
HERCULE-LT-2020-03 - HERCULE-AG Hercule III Action Grant
HERCULE-LT-2020-01 - HERCULE-AG Hercule III Action Grant

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

Financial support to periodical, specialised publications.

Expected Impact:

Awareness raising among the judiciary and other branches of the legal profession as regards protecting the Union’s financial interests. This will be measured by the number of copies of publications distributed to stakeholders and the type and number of methods of dissemination of relevant scientific knowledge.
TopicDetails.conditions:
1.   Eligible countries: described in section 2.2 of the Call document.

 

 

2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in sections 6.2 of the Call Document.

 

Admissibility

Applications must be submitted before the call deadline.

Applications must be submitted electronically via the Participant Portal Electronic Submission System. Paper submissions are no longer accepted.

Applications (including annexes and supporting documents) must be submitted using the forms provided inside the Participant Portal Electronic Submission System.

Your application must be readable, accessible and printable and contain all the requested information, required annexes and supporting documents.

A grant will not exceed 80% of the total eligible costs. In exceptional and duly justified cases, the financial support for an action may be increased to a maximum of 90% of the eligible costs.

Eligibility

Applications must be submitted by:

  1. national or regional administrations in a participating country which promote the strengthening of action at European Union level to protect the Union’s financial interests; and

  2. research and educational institutes and non-profit-making entities that have been established and operating in a participating country for at least a year and promote the strengthening of action at European Union level to protect the Union’s financial interests.

Applications from third countries are subject to the conditions in Article 7(2) of the Hercule III Regulation => Currently, applicants from non-EU countries cannot submit applications.

Only applications by single applicants are allowed. No consortium is allowed to apply.

The budget for an action for which a grant is requested must NOT be lower than EUR 40 000. Therefore, the requested grant for the action must be at least EUR 32 000 (= 80% of EUR 40 000).

The duration of the project will not exceed the following number of months following the signature of the grant agreement by both parties:

- 18 months for Topic 1 "Comparative law studies and dissemination"

- 12 months for Topic 2 "Cooperation and development of networks"

- 18 months for Topic 3 "Periodical publications"

3.   Evaluation

      3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in section 6 of the Call document.
   

      3.2 For submission and evaluation process, see the Call document.

 

4.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: described in section 8 of the Call document.

 

5.   Proposal templates and model grant agreements (MGA):

      Standard proposal template
      Detailed budget template
      Guide for applicants
      Mono-beneficiary Model Grant Agreement

      
     

This is a call for Mono-beneficiary grants only.

6.   Additional documents:

Annual Work Programme
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
For further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals, please contact: OLAF-FMB-HERCULE@ec.europa.eu

F&T Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.


IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.


H2020 Online Manual – Please use the manual with caution and only for the Participant Portal tools guidance, i.e. Submission service and Beneficiary register, because it is H2020 specific and does not cover the Justice Programme rules. Some aspects of the Justice Programme are different from the provisions of the H2020 programme.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action and topic, as these cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

callDetailsJSONItem.staticAdditionalInfo:
Hercule III-funded actions aim to protect the financial interests of the European Union by preventing and combating fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities affecting the financial interests of the Union.

The Commission will encourage projects related to legal training and studies having transnational and multidisciplinary dimensions.

Maximum project duration:

- Topic 1 "Comparative law studies and dissemination": 18 months

- Topic 2 "Cooperation and development of networks": 12 months

- Topic 3 "Periodical publications": 18 months

Budget Information

The indicative available budget for this Call is EUR 500 000.

The grants will cover a maximum of 80% (90% in exceptional and duly justified cases) of the eligible costs of the action.

The budget for an action for which a grant is requested must NOT be lower than EUR 40 000. Therefore, the requested grant for the action must be at least EUR 32 000 (= 80% of EUR 40 000).
